title: Advanced - Job Interview 2
description: Learn job interview 2 through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Thanks for coming in today, did you have any trouble finding us? Please take a seat.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: So, let's get started; tell me a bit about your educational background.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Sure! Well, I graduated with honors from Chesterton University with a major in Business Administration, with a specialization in Information Management, and I minored in psychology. I chose this course of study for two reasons: I wanted to gain some practical, marketable skills, which the information management track provided, and I also feel that interpersonal skills are essential for professional success, hence the minor in psychology.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Interesting. And, your postgraduate studies?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well, I am really passionate about consumer behavior, so I pursued a master's in that area. I also strive to keep my professional skills current, so I continuously attend seminars and conferences related management and customer service.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Very good. Now, tell me a little bit about your work experience. I see here that you previously worked at Oracle.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yeah, I worked as their customer support manager, which brought me a breadth of experience in both client care, and process management. I supervised and coordinated the customer support team as well as implemented new strategies to achieve better customer satisfaction.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Interesting...

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes, in this position I was able to make some pretty significant contributions to the overall success of the company. With the different initiatives that we implemented, we lowered our churn rate to about five percent, which had a direct impact on revenue.

vocabulary.definition: The history of the education you've had

title: Advanced - Job Interview 3
description: Learn job interview 3 through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Very good. Now, I have a couple of final questions.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I hope they're not too hard!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, why should we hire you?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I think that I would be a perfect fit in this company. I have a unique combination of strong technical acumen, and outstanding soft skills; you know, I excel at building strong, long-term customer relationships. For example, when I headed the customer support department in my previous company, our team solved about seventy percent of our customers' problems. I decided that we needed better information and technical preparation on our products, so after I implemented a series of training sessions in coordination with our technical department, we were able to solve ninety percent of our customers' issues. Given the opportunity, I could bring this kind of success to this company.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Impressive! So, what would you consider to be your greatest weakness?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: To be honest, I struggle with organization and time management. Punctuality has never been a strength of mine. I find it hard to organize my time efficiently. I have actually addressed this weakness recently, by attending a workshop on efficient time management. It helped me a lot, by providing me with great insights on how to get organized and use my time efficiently, so I think I'm getting better now.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Great... Well, let me tell you that I am very pleased with this interview. We are short-listing our candidates this week, and next week we will inform our short listed candidates of the day and time for a second interview with our CEO.

dialogue.speaker: B

title: Upper - Intermediate Soccer
description: Learn intermediate soccer through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Welcome back, soccer fans. My name is Rick Fields and, as always, I am joined by my commentating wingman, Bob Copeland.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: And we're on the brink of soccer history today, as Ecuador and Brazil are tied one-one as we begin the second half of the 2022 World Cup!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: The ref calls the players for the kick off, and here we go! Ecuador quickly passes the ball to the midfield, but, ohhh, it's out of bounds.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: That will be a throw in for Brazil. Adriano has the ball and makes a long pass to Robinho, and the ref has called him offside.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: No question about it. He was offside by a mile! We have a goal kick for Ecuador. Edison Mendez heads it to Valenica, he shoots! Deflected by the defender and we have a corner kick.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Delgado takes the corner. We have a foul! Oh no, Dida, the goalkeeper, has fouled the Ecuadorian player! He gets a yellow card and that will be a penalty kick!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: This is the perfect opportunity for Ecuador to get ahead in this match and become World Champions! He gets ready for the kick. He shoots! and he...

title: Intermediate - Groundbreaking Research
description: Learn groundbreaking research through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: We've been over this a thousand times. The data is irrefutable! Look, we've done extensive research, built studies, and read the literature, and there is conclusive evidence to support my theory!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Horowitz, I beg to differ. Even in your most recent study, the investigative approach was flawed! You know as well as I do that the collection of data was not systematic, and there is a large margin of error. To draw a definitive conclusion based on that data would be misleading

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: That is preposterous!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: You are trying to single-handedly solve one of the world's greatest mysteries, and yet you are oblivious to the fact that you are wrong!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I am not wrong! The chicken came first!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: No! The egg came first!

title: Elementary - How Would You Like Your Eggs
description: Learn how would you like your eggs through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Wow, you're up early today! What's for breakfast?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well, I felt like baking, so I made some muffins.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Smells good! I'll make some coffee. Do you want me to make you some eggs?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Sure, I’ll take mine, sunny side up.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Eww, I don't know how you can eat your eggs like that! Ever since I was small, I've had eggs and soldiers.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: You know, my dad had scrambled eggs eggs every morning for twenty years. It drove my mom crazy!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: You know what really drives me crazy? When I ask for soft boiled eggs, and they overcook them, so they come out hard boiled! How can you dip your toast into a hard boiled egg?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: You're so picky sometimes.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Here you go, honey, fried eggs.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Dammit! I asked for sunny side up! How many times do I have to tell you.

title: Advanced - Buying Underwear 1

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Um, I'm just having a look around. It's my girlfriend's birthday tomorrow. I’m trying to find her something.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well, you can't give her granny panties. Have you thought about getting her some sleepwear? We've got these lovely, silky nighties. Or, how about a nice panty-and and-bra set. Look, here's a nice satin push-up bra, and you can choose a few different styles of undies to go with it.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Sure that's fine.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: This is so awkward...what ones do I pick? What size is she?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well, do you want a thong, some bikini briefs, maybe this nice pair of lacy boy shorts?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Just pick something and get the hell out of here.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Um, I’ll go with these two.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: This is mortifying; I just want to get this over with. She better thank me for this...

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Finally!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, sir. I'm going to have to take a look inside your bag.

title: Intermediate - You Are Fired
description: Learn you are fired through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Hi Isabel! You wanted to see me?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes Anthony, come on in. Have a seat.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Is everything okay? You seem a bit preoccupied.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well, Anthony, this is not going to be an easy conversation. The company has made some decisions which will have a direct impact on your employment.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Okay...

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I don't want to beat around the bush so I'm just gonna come out with it. We are going to have to let you go.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What? Why? I mean... just like that? I'm fired?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I'm sorry but, to be honest, you are a terrible employee!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What! I resent that!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Anthony, you were caught making international calls from the office phone, you called in sick in eight times this month and you smell like alcohol!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: ...The rings please. May this ring be blessed so he who gives it and she who wears it may abide in peace, and continue in love until life's end.

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Umm... that's the thumb, Nick.

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Hey, Gary, great to see you again. Please have a seat. So tell me, what seems to be the problem?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Thanks, doc. I've got a really bad toothache! I can't eat anything, and look, my face is all swollen. I think it might be my wisdom tooth.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, let's have a look. Open wide. Hmm... this doesn't look good. Well, it looks like you have a cavity and your crown is loose. We'll need to put in a filling before it gets any worse, and the crown probably needs to be refitted. I'm going to order some x-rays.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Is it gonna hurt?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: No, not at all! Just lay back and relax.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Ok, spit.

title: Intermediate - F1 Racing
description: Learn f1 racing through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Welcome back racing fans! My name is Rick Fields and, as always, I am joined by my partner in crime, Bob Copeland.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: We're in the last stretch of this very exciting race, and Kimi Räikkönen is leading the pack with only four laps to go! They are heading to turn three and Lewis Hamilton tries to pass Räikkönen! It's a close one and, oh no! Hamilton hits the wall!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: He came in too fast, jammed on the breaks and spun out. We have a yellow flag and the pace car is making its way onto the track.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: The cleanup crew is towing the heavily damaged car and the green flag drops! Räikkönen is still in the lead with only two laps to go!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Smoke is coming out of his car! He seems to be having engine trouble! He makes his way into the pit, and Fernando Alonso takes the lead!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: How unlucky for Räikkönen, and this race is over ladies and gentlemen, Alonso takes the checkered flag!

title: Upper - Intermediate Im Sorry I Love You 7
description: Learn intermediate im sorry i love you 7 through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Thank god you showed up when you did! He's insane! Do you think we should call the police?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Don't worry about it, I'll call my friend and have him take care of it. I can't believe he was stalking you all these years. What a nut job!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I know! Well... he said I'm not pregnant. I'm sorry if I got you all worked up over nothing. I want you to know that I didn't do it on purpose...

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Don't apologize! From the moment I met you, not a day has gone by when I haven't thought of you. And now that I'm with you again, I'm... I'm just scared, Veronica. The closer I get to you, the worse it gets. The thought of not being with you, I mean, I just can't handle it! We were made for each other, Veronica. You are my everything, my soul mate. What can I do?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Just hold me... I'll always be here for you, no matter what. And together, we can tackle whatever life throws at us. I believe in us, Veronica.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I'm so happy to hear that! I knew we belong together. I love you so much.

dialogue.text: Officer, officer, there is, like, a witch creature back there! We tied her up but she broke free, and she was about to have us for dinner!

title: Intermediate - Using The ATM

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I know where to put my card! Stupid machine, talking to me like I'm an idiot...

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: B

title: Elementary - At The Pharmacy
description: Learn at the pharmacy through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Hello sir, how can I help you?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes, I need this prescription please.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Let's see. Okay, so 50 mg of Prozac, would you prefer this in capsule or tablet?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Capsules are fine.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Okay, you should take 1 capsule 3 times a day. Be sure not to take it on an empty stomach, and also, don't ever mix it with alcohol!

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Oh, well that's okay, I'll get some later, thanks... Really it's no problem.

dialogue.speaker: A

title: Elementary - Baseball
description: Learn baseball through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Hello baseball fans, and welcome back to today's game! My name is Rick Fields and of course, I am here, once again, with the man that seals the deal, Bob Copeland.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: It's a beautiful day to see two world class teams face each other and fight for their right to be called champions.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, the national anthem has just been sung, and the umpire has started the game. It's time to play ball!

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: A very nice curve ball by the pitcher. The catcher gives him the sign, he winds up and Vargas gets a line drive!

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Great play!

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Home run by Okami! That puts this team ahead by two as we are at the bottom of the fifth inning here at Richie Stadium!

title: Intermediate - Looking for an Apartment
description: Learn looking for an apartment through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Hi! We are the Christianson's! We are here to see the apartment.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Oh, hi! Sure, come on in! Well, as you can see, the place has just been renovated. The previous tenants left a huge mess here, so the landlord has redone everything.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: It looks great. It's so bright and airy! What great light! I really like these hardwood floors. What's the square footage of this place?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well, it's about 120 square meters, or 1300 square feet, more or less. Oh, the landlord has also installed new kitchen appliances. There's a new dishwasher, and a professional-grade gas range. Really, at this price, this place is an amazing deal!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I love it! But what are the payment terms?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: First and last month rent as deposit and rent is due on the 1st of every month. Considering the amount of money invested into the apartment, it's a very good deal!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Yes, it is! Too good to be true...

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: The living room and dinning room are quite spacious as you can see, and down this hall, here's the master bedroom. It has a huge walk-in closet and an en suit bathroom. We can't go in there yet as the police... I mean the clean up crew hasn't finished.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What do you mean? What's in here?

title: Elementary - Will You Be My Girlfriend
description: Learn will you be my girlfriend through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Hey, you're early! Where's everyone?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well... I told them not to come. I made a reservation just for the two of us. I thought we could have an quiet evening all to ourselves.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Oh... why?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Jennifer, there's something I wanna ask you.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Sure. What is it?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Hmm... okay, here's the thing. I've always seen you as more than just a friend, and I can't take it any more. I know you better than anyone, I know the pros and cons of your personality, I even know what side of the bed is yours! I think we would be great together, don't you?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Are you serious? We've been friends for years! We can't just change that overnight!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I know! I never had the guts to tell you... until today. So, what do you say? Are you willing to give me a shot?

title: Intermediate - At The Airport
description: Learn at the airport through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Next please! Hello sir, may I see your passport please?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes, here you go.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Will you be checking any bags.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes, I'd like to check three pieces.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, sir. Airline policy allows only two pieces of checked luggage, at twenty kilograms each, plus one piece of carry-on luggage. I will have to charge you extra for the additional suitcase.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: What? Why! I am taking an intercontinental flight! I'm flying sixteen thousand kms! How am I supposed to only take two, twenty kilo bags? That's absurd!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I am sorry, sir, there's nothing I can do. You cannot board the flight with that large bag either. Carry-on bags must fit in the over-head compartment or under your seat. That bag is clearly too big.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Now I see. You charge next to nothing for an international ticket, but when it comes to charging for any other small thing, you charge an arm and a leg! So tell me, miss, how much will I have to pay for all of this.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Let's see... six hundred and twenty-five US dollars.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: That's more than my round-trip ticket!

title: Upper - Intermediate Im Sorry I Love You 8
description: Learn intermediate im sorry i love you 8 through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Veronica! Veronica! Veronica! Are you OK?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Steven! What's going on! Who were those guys? I didn't know you have a gun! What's going on!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I will come clean as soon as we get to safety, OK? For now, you have to trust me, please! I would never do anything to hurt you.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Steven, I...

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Okay, run! I haven't been completely honest with you Veronica, I'm sorry. I'm not a fireman. I'm not even from the United States. I'm a spy for the Indian government.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: What? Why didn't you tell me before? What are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: When I was a young boy, I used to play cricket my father back in my hometown of Hyderabad. It was a peaceful town, and my father was a renowned chemist. One day, he was approached by members of the CIA, claiming that my father had made the discovery of the millennium in his small lab back at the university where he taught bio-chemistry. I never saw him again. I vowed to discover the whereabouts of my father and consequently joined the Indian Intelligence Bureau.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: What does that have to do with those men shooting at us? Most importantly, why did you lie to me!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, I wasn't supposed to meet you. I wasn't supposed to fall in love with you, but you have to believe me when I tell you that what I feel for you is real.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I can't believe this! Why are all these things happening to me! I can't take it anymore! Let me out of the car!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Veronica, wait!

title: Advanced - Big Bang Theory
description: Learn big bang theory through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What's up? You don't look too good.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yeah, my head hurts, that's all. I've been in physics class all day. It's killer!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I liked physics. It's all math, really; arcs, curves, velocity, cool stuff.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, but today's lesson was all about the creation of the universe.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: A physics class about the creation of the universe? That's some pretty unscientific language there. Sounds more religous to me.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: It's all religion. Take the theory of the Big Bang. How is it possible that all of the stuff in the universe comes from an explosion? That's no better than Atlas carrying the globe on his back or African myths about turtles and stuff.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Turtles? Whatever... Look, all that's required for the creation of matter an imbalance of particles and anti-particles. At least, that's what the math says.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Math, shmath. What's the evidence?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: There is evidence! You know Edwin Hubble? He's the guy who in the early twentieth century was the first scientist to measure the drift of matter in the universe, thus advancing notions of an expanding universe. What would it be expanding from? Well, the Big Bang... DUH!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Anyway, it's just a theory. Why do people go around touting theories? Where's the scientific rigor in that?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Dude, don't equivocate. A theory only becomes a theory after withstanding rigorous testing. You slept through class, didn't you?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Agh! You're making my head hurt again! Quit with the questions!

title: Upper - Intermediate Weather Forecast
description: Learn intermediate weather forecast through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: ...And now, let's go to Kenny Williams for today's weather forecast.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Thank you Bill, and good morning Salt Lake City!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What's the weather looking like today, Kenny?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well, it's a bit of a mixed bag in Utah today; we've got heavy cloud cover here in Northern Utah, and we're calling for scattered showers throughout the day, with a day-time high of forty-five degrees. Now, if we move down to the south of the state, we can see that a cold front is moving in. We can expect clear skies, but it will be quite cold, with temperatures hovering around the thirty degree mark.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: It's a chilly day folks, so don't forget your coats! What about tomorrow Kenny? Do you have good news for us?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well, it'll be a rainy day for Northern Utah; we can expect some isolated downpours in the morning. Winds will be coming in from the North East, with gusts reaching twenty-three miles per hour. Salt Lake City can expect the rain to turn to sleet in the evening. Things are looking a bit better for the South; we'll see cloudy skies with a chance of showers. Later in the day, we can expect partly-cloudy skies, with a forecast high of thirty-eight degrees.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: You heard it folks! It's gonna be a cold one!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: That's right Bill. We will have more later on today on the six o'clock news. That's the weather forecast for this morning.

dialogue.text: Valerie! Hi! Wow how are you? It's been such a long time!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Darlene! Indeed, it's been a while! How have you been? Wow, you look amazing! I love what you've done with your hair!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Really? Thanks! I went to that hair salon that you told me about, but enough about me! Look at you! You haven't aged a day since the last time I saw you! What is your secret!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Ha ha, come on! Well, I've been watching what I eat, and working out three times a week. By the way, I heard your son recently graduated!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Yes, my little Paul is finally a doctor. They grow up so fast you know.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: He is such a handsome guy. He gets his looks from his mother of course!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Thank you! What about your daughter, Pamela? I heard she has passed the bar exam and married recently.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Oh yes. She had a beautiful wedding in Cozumel Mexico and we all attended.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Such a lovely girl. I hope my Paul is lucky enough to find a girl like that someday!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: But of course! Well, it's been great talking to you, but I have to get going.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Same here! We will catch up soon, maybe over coffee!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: That would be great! Give me a call!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: See you soon! Bye! Ugg... I can't stand that woman or her obnoxious son.

title: Advanced - Movie Review
description: Learn movie review through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Welcome back movie lovers to another " Premier Movie Review". My name is Richard Clarke and I am joined today by the very erudite David Watson.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Thank you Dick. Today we are going to talk about the movie " Lion King". Tell me Dave, what is your impression of this film?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, I think this film is simply a fable, depicting man's eternal greed for power, and in my opinion, it's a very fine film. Even despite the accusations of plagiarism traditional folk tales from other countries. The musical score was amazing, the animation was very well done, and the story was simply enchanting.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I think otherwise. Even though the animation was technically strong, and as you say, the score and songs performed by Elton John were great, the film lacks a certain originality; it lacked heart. And I would dare to say, it was too predictable.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Predictable! How! Come on Dick, It's a G-rated movie! It's for the kids! It's not a thriller!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well, that's just it. It did have some very dramatic and intense scenes For example when Mufasa dies, or the dark, grim portrayal of Scar. Even so, the film is linear. Mufasa dies, Simba runs away thinking it's his fault. Falls in love and returns to retake what is rightfully his. It's just too cliché.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: How can it be cliché? It's a fable! It's telling a time-honoured story! The movie make a point of how the hunger for power leads to corruption, and teaches children the value of respect, life and love.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: You have always been so soft, Dave!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Open your heart Dick. Don't shut us out.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Anyway... That's all for today folks! Join us next time as we talk about "How to lose a guy in 10 days" I'm sure you'll love that one Dave!

title: Intermediate - Where are you from
description: Learn where are you from through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Where to, miss?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Hi! Crenshaw and Hawthorne, at the Holiday Inn that is on that corner.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Sure thing. So, where are you flying in from?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: From China.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Really? You don't look very Chinese to me, if you don't mind me saying so.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: It's fine. I am actually from Mexico. I was in China on a business trip, visiting some local companies that manufacture bathroom products.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Wow sounds interesting! Excuse me if I am being a bit nosy but, how old are you?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Don't you know it's rude to ask a lady her age?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Don't get me wrong! It's just that you seem so young and already doing business overseas!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well thank you! In that case, I am 26 years old, and what about yourself?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I am 40 years old and was born and raised here in the good old U.S of A, although I have some Colombian heritage.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Really? That's great! Do you speak some Spanish?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Uh... yeah.. of course!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Que bien! Entonces podemos hablar en espanol!

title: Advanced - Global Warming
description: Learn global warming through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: And therefore, global warming is the greatest deception of the early 21st century. Questions?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Uh… yeah. In the lecture you said there’s more evidence in the scientific record supporting global cooling?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, yes, essentially, the historical record supports a theory of climate cycles. Warming and cooling are cooperating processes in the planetary eco-system.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: If that’s true and the planet is getting cooler, what explains the rapid melting of the polar ice caps and the dramatic rise in the global average temperatures?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: But are global temperatures rising? If you look at the data from nineteen seventy-five you’ll…

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: You’ll be misled. If you were serious, you would look at the record starting in the 1880’s. Then you would see how dramatically the earth’s temperature has changed.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Young lady, I beg to differ. Look, the point of the lecture was to emphasize that there is evidence for both sides, and I'm putting forth the argument that there's greater evidence in support of the global cooling hypothesis. Look, it's an indisputable fact that the public is being manipulated and scared into believing there’s some kind of climate crisis; this scaremongering is done, quite simply, for political reasons.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: But even without the uncomfortable reality that greenhouse gases like carbon dioxide contribute to global warming, isn’t the topic appropriate for politicians to discuss?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Not if they want to use your tax dollars and mine to fund completely unnecessary initiatives.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yeah, like conservation, protecting endangered species and investing in renewable energy. At the very least, you have to concede that this debate has the potential to end our dependence on foreign oil. Buying oil supports autocratic countries that use these revenues to devastating ends.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Why, I’ve never been so disrespected in all of my days. I’m a professor, a scientist and researcher of high regard.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yeah, and a duplicitous one at that. Everyone knows you’re in the pocket of the oil lobby. Why should we trust your so-called findings more than tobacco institute studies which say smoking doesn’t harm health? You’re full of it.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Some people just cannot handle civil debate!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: You know what I mean.

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Honey...

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: You do?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Oh, I love you too!

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A

title: Intermediate - Mobile Phone Plan
description: Learn mobile phone plan through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yeah, I've just moved here, and I'd like to activate my cell phone, and I'm not sure if I should go with a prepaid plan, or a monthly rate plan.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I see. Well, can I have a look at your phone? Unfortunately, this phone can't be used in the US; it's not compatible with our 3G network.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: What? Really? I don't really want to have to buy a new phone.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, you're in luck! You see, if you sign up for our three-year plan, we'll throw in a handset for free.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Really? What's the catch?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: There's no catch! You just choose a plan, sign a three-year contract and, that's it! Actually, we're running a special promotion right now, and we're giving away a Blackberry Curve with our special Mega Value forty dollar plan.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: So what does this plan include?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, you get nine hundred anytime minutes, and you can also enjoy free mobile to mobile calling to other Tel-Mobile clients, one thousand text messages per month, and unlimited evening and weekend minutes. Oh, and we also offer a rollover option.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Wow, all this for forty dollars per month?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: That's right, plus the activation fee, the emergancy services fee, the monthly service fee, oh, and any charges for extra minutes, and...

title: Upper - Intermediate Complaining at a Restaurant
description: Learn intermediate complaining at a restaurant through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Excuse me, waiter? Waiter!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes, sir? What can I do for you?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I've been sitting here for the past twenty minutes and no one has offered me a glass of water, brought any bread to the table and our appetizers haven't been served yet! You know, in this kind of establishment, I'd expect much better service.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I am sorry, sir. I'll check on your order right away.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Here you are, sir. The foie gras for the lady, and a mushroom soup for you.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Waiter, I ordered a cream of mushroom soup with asparagus. This soup is obviously too runny, and it's over-seasoned. It's completely inedible!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Okay, I do apologize for that. Can I bring you another soup, or would you like to order something else?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Take this foie gras back as well, it's rubbery and completely overcooked. And look at the portion size! How can you charge twenty-five dollars for a sliver of duck liver?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Right away... sir.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What do you mean? We are paying for this. If I'm shelling out my hard earned bucks, I expect value for money!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Here you are, sir. I hope it is alright now. The chef has prepared it specially for you.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Yes, fine.

title: Upper - Intermediate Bad news boss
description: Learn intermediate bad news boss through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: ... Now that we have been over the gory details of our disastrous first quarter, Ed! Give us some good news. How are things looking for us in terms of sales this month?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Uh well...would you like the bad news first or the really bad news?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What? Ed, don't tell me you only have bad news!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well sir, our sales have dropped, no plunged, fifty percent in the past month alone. We are currently overstocked and overstaffed and our profits are falling fast. The market is in recession and we have no way of moving our inventory, or getting rid of our staff. If we consider redundancies, it would cost us a fortune because of the new regulations governing compensation packages. It's a real mess.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: For crying out loud... How fast are we losing money?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Um...how can I put this? Let's just say that at this pace, we will be filing for Chapter eleven in less than three months.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What! Geez! How could this have happened? So what's the bad news?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Oh, that's the really bad news. Our supplier suffered QC problems and, well, half of our production is faulty. We're going to have to recall all items sold in the last quarter. And the worst part? We're going to have to shoulder this cost.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Are you joking? Get the supplier on the line now! They have to assume the costs of this mess!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: We tried that, sir. The factory has gone under and the owner apparently has fled the country.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: We're doomed!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: There is some really good news though!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Really? What!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I got offered a new job!

title: Intermediate - Breaking Up
description: Learn breaking up through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Honey, do you have a second?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Sure! Are you okay? You seem a bit worried. What's on your mind?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: We need to talk.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Okay...

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I've been thinking, and well, I think we need to start seeing other people.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: What? Why? I mean, we've had our ups and downs, and we have the occasional disagreement, but we're happy together, aren't we?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: That's just it, I'm not happy anymore, Tim. It's not you, it's me. I know that I can be hard to deal with, and you are a great guy! You are the type of guy that any woman would kill for!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: So, what are you saying? You're breaking up with me because I'm perfect?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Tim, you are too good for me. You deserve someone who can make you smile and make you happy the way that you made me happy. Oh, I could say that I'll be all you need, but that would be a lie. I know I'd only hurt you, I know I'd only make you cry.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Baby, come on. Don't do this to me! Whatever it is, we can work it out. Just give me another chance! I know that we can get through this, but we gotta stick together! Don't leave me.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I can't, Tim. I hope someday you can find some way to understand I'm only doing this for you. I don't really wanna go but, deep in my heart I know this is the kindest thing to do.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Laura...

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Here are your keys. I'll send my sister to pick up the rest of my things next week. I'm sorry, Tim. I wish you all the best, and I hope that one day we can meet again. I'll always love you. Goodbye.

vocabulary.definition: Good times and bad times

Solve, overcome
Solve, overcome

To cancel or postpone
To begin living a stable and orderly life
To live together in a sexual relationship, especially when not legally married.
To form or make a proposal, especially of marriage.

title: Elementary - Registering for University
description: Learn registering for university through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Excuse me? Is this where I register? I'd like to sign up for my courses for next semester.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes, of course. I need your student ID please.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Here you are.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Okay, Susan. It says here that you are a business major and you are in your second year. Is this information correct?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Yes. I do want to take some additional credits this year to get a minor in psychology.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Sure. That's not a problem. Do you have the list of courses you want to take this semester?

dialogue.speaker: A

title: Elementary - Golf

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Whoa, that's a lot of cash! Let's go to the course and see how Tiger Woods is doing.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: All right, were're here at the eighth hole. It's a par four, and has some very difficult hazards which many golfers find difficult to avoid. Although, I did see Jack Nicklaus hit a hole in one on this very same hole!

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Oh no! Not a good swing at all! It's definitely not his day today. On the seventh hole he got a bogey and before that he barely made par. He will definitely not get a birdie on this shot.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: It seems that his ball has flown somewhere deep in the trees. He is having a hard time finding it and even his caddie has climbed a tree to try and spot it.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Oh no! A bear! Run, Tiger, run! Somebody call animal control!

title: Intermediate - Dr Plumber
description: Learn dr plumber through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Good afternoon! Did you call for a plumber?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes, yes I did. Please come in! I'm so glad you came! This old house is falling apart! Come on into the bathroom. See, here, there's water leaking everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I see. Let me have a look. It seems that your toilet is clogged, and that's why it won't flush. Let me just get my plunger. No, that's not working either. I suspect that there's some sort of foreign object in the pipes that's causing a blockage. That's what's making your toilet overflow.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Oh, that must be because of my four-year-old daughter. She is always flushing things down the toilet. You know how kids are.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Yeah, I have a little one myself. Anyway, these water pipes are really rusty, so they also should be changed. That could be causing water to not drain completely; that might lead to more problems in the future. I would also suggest fixing this faucet that isn't shutting off properly. I could have it all finished by today if it's urgent.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: That would be great! Is it expensive?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Let's see... I would say about eight hundred dollars.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: What? That's more than I make in a day and I'm a heart surgeon!

title: Advanced - You Missed The Deadline
description: Learn you missed the deadline through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: And so, I just wanted to check in with you and find out where we are with this project. As you know, you've missed a fairly significant deadline last week, and this will negativity impact the team's ability to move forward with the next stages of this project.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I know, I'm really sorry that I missed the deadline. But really, it wasn't my fault. You see, we had all of these unexpected technical problems at the last minute, and that I couldn't get into the database and extract the kind of information that I needed for the data analyis. You know, if the tech guys would have done their job and kept the CRM stable, then I wouldn't have missed my deadline.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Oh, come on! An excuse like that is tantamount to lying. You're essentially blaming the tech team for your time management issues, rather than accepting responsibility for the fact that you were procrastinating for the past two weeks.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: No, I'm not trying to pass the buck here; I know that it was me who is ultimately responsible for getting this done. But the thing is, I could have finished on time if the system hadn't gone down. And you know, with everything I've got going on now, I can't afford to waste time dealing with technical problems. I've got a lot on my plate and there are only twenty-four hours in a day...

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I'm not going to accept this excuse. You're using these small technical glitches as a crutch and trying to rationalize the fact that you've missed your deadline. Look, we have standards and I expect you to live up to those standards. No more phoney excuses. If you're in over your head, you tell me. No more missed deadlines. Now, I want that data on my desk by nine am!

title: Advanced - Presidential Speech
description: Learn presidential speech through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Good evening, my fellow Americans. Three days from now, after a half-century of service of our country, I shall lay down the responsibilities of office as, in a traditional and solemn ceremony, the authority of the Presidency is vested in my successor. This evening I come to you with a message of leave-taking and farewell, and to share a few final thoughts with you, my countrymen.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Like every other citizen, I wish the new President, and all who will labor with him, Godspeed. I pray that the coming years will be blessed with peace and prosperity for all.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Our people expect their President and the Congress to find essential agreement on questions of great importance, the wise resolution of which will better shape the future of our great nation. My own relations with Congress began on a remote and tenuous basis when, long ago, a member of the Senate appointed me to West Point. I then had the pleasure of building more intimate relationship with Congress during the war and immediate post-war period. Finally, we have progressed to the mutually interdependent relationship we've had during these past eight years.

vocabulary.definition: Flimsy, weak, or uncertain

title: Advance - Presidential Speech 2
description: Learn presidential speech 2 through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: We now stand ten years past the midpoint of a century that has witnessed four major wars among great nations. Three of these involved our own country. Despite the carnage of these conflicts, America is today the strongest, the most influential and most productive nation in the world. We are understandably proud of this pre-eminence, yet we realize that America's leadership and prestige depend, not merely upon our unmatched material progress, riches and military strength, but on how we use our power in the interests of world peace and human betterment.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Throughout America's adventure in free government, such basic purposes have been to keep the peace; to foster progress in human achievement, and to enhance liberty, dignity and integrity among peoples and among nations.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: We pray that peoples of all faiths, all races, all nations, may have their great human needs satisfied; that those now denied opportunity shall come to enjoy it to the full; that all who yearn for freedom may experience its spiritual blessings; that those who have freedom will understand, also, its heavy responsibilities; that all who are insensitive to the needs of others will learn charity; that the scourges of poverty, disease and ignorance will be made to disappear from the earth, and that, in the goodness of time, all peoples will come to live together in a peace guaranteed by the binding force of mutual respect and love.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Now, on Friday noon, I am to become a private citizen. I am proud to do so. I look forward to it. Thank you, and good night.

title: Upper - Intermediate Mechanic

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Howdy! Nice car! What seems to be the problem?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I don't know! This stupid old car started spewing white smoke and it just died on me. Luckily, I managed to start it up and drive it here. What do you think it is?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Not sure yet. How about you pop the hood and we can take a look. Hmmm, it doesn't look good.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: What do you mean? My daddy gave me this car for my birthday last month. It's brand new!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well missy, the white smoke that you saw is steam from the radiator. You overheated your engine so now the pistons are busted and so is your transmission. You should have called us and we could have towed you over here when your car died.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Ugh... So how long is this going to take? An hour?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I'm afraid a bit more than that. We need to order the spare parts, take apart your electrical system, fuel pump and engine and then put it back together again. You are going to have to leave it here for at least two weeks.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: What! How am I supposed to get to school or go shopping? This is not happening!

title: Advanced - Gambling

dialogue.text: Did you hear? The state is thinking of legalizing gambling in our city! Soon we are gonna have amazing hotels and casinos here which will be good for our business!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Are you serious? Gambling is a vice industry built on deception and fed by the intentional exploitation of human weakness for the sole purpose of monetary gain! It disgusts me.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What are you talking about? How does it exploit people?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well, to begin with, Gambling is addictive, ruins marriages, destroys families and bankrupts communities. Once you are addicted it is very difficult to stop. People have lost their houses, cars and been left out on the street after becoming addicted. Secondly, it exploits because men become addicted to gambling most often because of the action and risk. Women gamble to escape, and senior citizens will start gambling for the social interaction. Underage gamblers often start gambling on sports with friends and then illegal bookies.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Geez! Now that I think about it, maybe legalizing gambling isn't such a good idea! Although, I have been to Las Vegas, and I didn't become addicted or anything like that.

dialogue.speaker: B

title: Advance - Global View - Capital Punishment
description: Learn global view - capital punishment through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Do you think we should be tougher on crime?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well, it depends on what you mean.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: For example, we could bring back the death penalty for murder, give longer prison sentences for lesser offences and lock up juvenile offenders.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Those really sound like Draconian measures. Firstly, what do you do about miscarriages of justice if you've already put innocent people to death?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: You'd only use capital punishment if you were absolutely sure that you'd convicted the right person.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: But, there've been many cases of wrongful conviction where people have been imprisoned for many years. The authorities were sure at the time, but later it was shown that the evidence was unreliable. In some cases, it'd been fabricated by the police.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, no system of justice can be perfect, but surely there's a good case for longer prison sentences to deter serious crime.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I doubt whether they could act as an effective deterrent while the detection rate is so low. The best way to prevent crime is to convince people who commit it that they're going to be caught. It doesn't make sense to divert all your resources into the prison system.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: But if you detect more crimes, you'll still need prisons. In my reckoning, if we could lock up more juvenile criminals, they'd learn that they couldn't get away with it. Soft sentences will merely encourage them to do it again.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes, but remember that prisons are often schools for criminals. To remove crime from society, you really have to tackle its causes.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, if I were president, I would impose tougher laws and punishment. I would have a peaceful society based on fear of punishment, not consciousness of doing the right thing.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: You sound like a dictator!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well if it works, why not?

title: Upper - Intermediate Global View - Animal Rights
description: Learn intermediate global view - animal rights through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: You should have seen the T.V. show that was on last night, the topic it covered was really interesting; animal rights.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Do you really believe in that? If they are going to focus on something, they should do it on civil rights.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Yes, but we can’t deny that animals are vulnerable, defenseless, and are completely at the mercy of human beings.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I understand your point, but we continue to have transgressions against human rights. If so much attention weren’t devoted to the topic of animals, we would then concentrate more on saving a human being instead of protecting a koala.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: You can’t compare apples and oranges; I believe that both topics are important and that we can’t ignore them, the mistreatment of animals can cause a great environmental imbalance.I believe that governments should prohibit activities like poaching.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well, you are right on that point. This is the reason that I don’t buy leather and I try to buy synthetic products.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: At least you’re doing your part. My contribution is to have a pet in the house that I treat like a member of the family.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: As long as you don’t treat it better than your wife, it’s fine.

title: Advanced - Global View - Darwins Theory Of Evolution
description: Learn global view - darwins theory of evolution through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: It’s been a long time since I last saw you. Where have you been?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: The exams and plans I have to turn in in are driving me crazy, I don’t even have time to sleep.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: It’s the same for me. I'm up to my neck in work, but at least finals are coming soon and we’ll have a vacation. Where are you going now?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I’m going to Anthropology class and now with the year anniversary of Darwin, it’s the only thing we study. Frankly, I'm sick and tired and tired of hearing about this guy.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What? Why? How can you not like Darwin? I mean the man changed the entire perception of how things came to and his theory is backed by pretty solid evidence!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I don’t like him. His theory of human evolution and natural selection is full of holes. It lacks the solid evidence of which you speak of.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: That statement puts you at odds with half of the academy. Not to mention your professors! Furthermore, the explanation proposed by Darwin about the origin of species and the mechanism of natural selection constitutes a grand step toward a coherent understanding of the world and evolutionist ideas.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I'm not minimizing his grand contributions, it’s just that his theory reminds of the conundrum of the chicken and the egg.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: The question is, which was first? The chicken or the egg? I feel the same regarding his theory. How does the first cell of life come to be?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Interesting. I think that question is better suited for my philosophy class. In the meantime, how about we settle this... with a due!

This of course is considering that you don't default on a payment!

dialogue.text: I thought you were my friend and would support me on this! I just want to feel better about myself and feel more attractive.

dialogue.text: You don’t need plastic surgeryto do that. You are fine the way you are and you have guys drooling all over you! Plus, plastic surgeryhurts!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Yeah! When I got my nose job I was black and blue for a week!

title: Elementary - Daily Life - Learning How To Drive
description: Learn daily life - learning how to drive through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Ok! I'm ready for my driving lesson! Should I start the car?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Hold on there Fittipaldi, first let's go over things one more time. Now before you even think of starting the car, make sure your seat is at a comfortable position and you can grip the steering wheel firmly. Next check your rear view mirrors to make sure you can see properly.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: We have been through this a million times! Let's get going already! I'm ready!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Fine start the car. Now gently step on the clutch and shift to 1st gear. Good, now accelerate gently and let go of the clutch as you do it. There we go, good!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I'm doing it! I'm driving! This is awesome! Le'ts turn some music on!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Keep your eyes on the road! No music! We are coming up to a red light, step on the brakes. What are you doing? I said the brakes! Look out for those people! Get off the sidewalk!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Get out of my way! This is just like playing video games!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: It's the police! Pull over!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: They'll never take me alive!

title: Advanced - The Weekend - Cooking A Thanksgiving Dinner
description: Learn the weekend - cooking a thanksgiving dinner through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Hello everyone and welcome back to our show. Today we are going to learn how to cook the perfect thanksgiving turkey! I will share a secret that I have kept for over 30 years on how to cook the perfect, most mouth watering, juiciest turkey in the world! Let's get started!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: First of all, we must bring out or key ingredient; whiskey. You see, the grains used to make whiskey along with the alcohol, brings out the flavor of the turkey meat. Let's pour 1 cup of whiskey on the turkey, and serve yourself a cup as well! Cheers! Ahhh! That's good 12 year whiskey right there. Ok, back to our turkey. Preheat your oven to 475 degrees Fahrenheit. Now have another cup of whiskey.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Now that the oven is hot, we place our bird on a rack inside a roasting pan. Let's add some whiskey to give some extra flavor and let's have another cup. That hit the spot. There we go, we can leave it in there for the next 45 minutes. In the meantime, lets have another sip of whiskey and start with our delicious pumpkin pie.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Lightly whisk together 2 eggs and the extra yolk in a large bowl. Once that's ready we can put sugar, spices such as cloves, grated nutmeg and cinnamon with some cream and dark rum into a saucepan. Slowly bring up to simmering point stirring occasionally. Now you may notice that we are using some dark rum in this pie. This is because the richness of the pumpkin is beautifully enhanced by the dark rum, so to celebrate this great occasion, yourself a glass! Cheers!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Now that we have finished with the filling, let's Bake the pie for 45 to 50 minutes until the filling has puffed up around the edges and the center is almost set. ALl done! A cup of rum to celebrate the completion of this great thanksgiving dinner!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: After waiting for an hour, and having a couple of drinks, it's time to check on our turkey! Take the turkey out of the oven, pick the turkey off of the ground. Don't worry, it will add flavor to this recipe. Now also remove the pie from the oven and serve while still hot! Cheers and happy thanksgiving!

vocabulary.definition: Potatoes that are boiled and mashed, often with milk and butter
Brown sauce made from the fat and juices of cooking meat
A mixture made of bread, herbs, etc. that has been stuffed inside a turkey and cooked with the turkey
An unfiltered, unsweetened, and non-alcoholic drink made of apple juice, sometimes with spices such as cinnamon
Corn still on the ear that has been boiled or grilled

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Alright settle down now, you’re gonna give yourself a heart attack.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Whoa… Viper! That’s the world’s highest and fastest roller coaster! You go at more than miles per hour! I wanna go on that one! Can I mom please? Can I ?

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Aww come on mom! I can handle it. I promise I wont ask for anything else! Besides, it’s not like I’m gonna throw up or anything…

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Alright! Yeah! This is amazing! See how high up we're going? Whoa… mmmf mmfff barf.

title: Intermediate - Daily Life - Wedding Doubts
description: Learn daily life - wedding doubts through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Man, I'm freaking out! You gotta help me!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Whoa whoa take it easy, relax. Geez, you're sweating like a pig! What's going on?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I can't go through with this! I just can't! I'm not ready for marriage! What was I thinking? I'm only thirty five years old! I've got my entire life ahead of me, adventures waiting! I can't settle down yet!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: What are you talking about? It wasn't more than a month ago that you were rambling on about how you are tired of living the life of a bachelor and how you envy your friends that have a family!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I know I know!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Let's think this through. First of all, you cannot leave Amy atthe altar. Not only will she be humiliated and kill you, but she is the woman that you love andthe woman of your dreams! Why would you want to end that or jeopardize it like this? Second of all, you are just getting cold feet. You know deep down inside that you want to marry her, so cut the crap and do it!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: You’re right. I'm being crazy! Ok, I'm ready, lets do this!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Great! Phew! That was a close one ! You had me going there for a minute I thought I was gonna have to slap some sense intoyou

title: Upper - Intermediate The Weekend - Buying a Camera
description: Learn intermediate the weekend - buying a camera through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Hello, ma'am, can I help you find something?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes, actually I'm looking to buy a camera.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: We've got a wide selection do you know if you'd like a point-and-shoot, or something a little fancier? Are you shopping for yourself or for someone else?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Actually I'm buying a camera for my husband.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Ah, well then I'd recommend a nice entry-level digital SLR.

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Sure thing, follow me. This here is the.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: The Canon Eos. Yeah it's ok, but I'm looking for something that performs better in low light, has a better display panel, and longer battery life.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Oh, ah, umthe Nikon D60 is a nice option.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yeah, but what kit lens does this camera come with? I don't want some bulky telephoto lens.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Oh, well this one has the, uh.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Looks to me like an 18-55mm lens. pretty standard, that will do. Not like my husband will be stalking celebrities or anything!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: So, ahem, can I interest you in any acc...

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Accessories? Do you carry polarizing filters?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Polarizing filter um we should! I'm sorry, ma'am. looks like we're sold out.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: No you're not! There are some right here!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Oh, well, would you look at that! Po-la-ri-zing filters.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Thanks for your help, Ralph!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: No problem, ma'am.

title: Upper - Intermediate The Office - Preparing a Budget
description: Learn intermediate the office - preparing a budget through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Welcome Mr and Mrs Carnwell, please take a seat.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: So I understand that your family spending has sky rocketed and you want to start budgeting.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: We have two kids and with allowances, paying their credit cards, ours and not to mention our mortgage and car payments. With the recent economic downturn, my husband's business has suffered and now we need some advice as to how we can prepare a family budget.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I see. Well you have come tothe right place. First what we need to do, is determine your cash flow. Knowing how much money is coming in will help us allocate spending to different categories such as mortgage, education, groceries, etc.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes that makes sense.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Secondly, I need you to bring all of your receipts forthe last two to three months. That way, we can determine what your average expenditures are and see which category you are spending money onthe most. Usually, your fixed costs are higher and we cant do much about that, but we can usually trim your variable costs such as entertainment or clothing.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: That's another thing. If you really want to stop spending so much money, throw away at least half of your credit cards!

vocabulary.definition: Rise rapidly, as in price
Beyond the ability to direct the actions of something
Plan the way to spend money in order to save more
Assign
To be honest, to say it directly

title: Upper - Intermediate Global View - New Year New Promises

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Did you read this? It says that the number one new years resolution make is to spend more time with friends and family.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Why would that be funny?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, think about it. We are a society that is always on the go, not because we have to, but because we want to.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: We work hard and spend less time at home because we are trying to provide for our family with goods and services that are usually unnecessary.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I don't agree, but anyways, I think you should start thinking of a new year's resolution yourself.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What's the point? We always make a new year's resolution and by February we will have forgotten about it. It's pointless.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well then maybe you should resolve to sticking to your goals and objectives.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What about you? Your gym bag is gathering dust and you still have brand new running shoes that are yet to be jogged in.

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Take it easy! Let's go tothe mall, window shop a little and see if there is anything she might like.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: That's just it! I don't know what to get her! Last year I got her a ring that was two sizes too big and a pair of shoes five sizes too small! I suck at getting presents for people.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: That's where you're making a big mistake! You can't just guess peoples' likes or sizes! Especially with clothes or jewelry. On top of that, I think that you should get your mom something that shows how much you love her. Atthe same time you should show her that you took the time and effort tolook for something that she would really like!

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What do you think of this one?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Eh, so so.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: And this one? Too flashy?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Nah, not too flashy.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Uhg! And this sweater from my aunt? Isn't it hideous?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I guess.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Are you even listening? I'm trying to have a conversation with you.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: And I'm trying to watch the game, but you're yapping on about your new clothes!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well I have to decide which gifts to keep and which to exchange for better ones when I go to the Boxing Day sales this afternoon!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Well could you do me the favor of making this quick? It's the third quarter and you've been blabbering on since the first!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Oh, your precious game. You watch the same game every year, and each year your beloved hometown team loses by at least three goals!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Oh no you didn't. You didn't just insult the Salsbury Seals, did you? Why don't you just. just go and return all of those stupid clothes and not come back until the sales are over?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I might just! Enjoy your stupid game!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: And Merry Christmas!

dialogue.speaker: A

title: Elementary - Daily Life - Fresh Start
description: Learn daily life - fresh start through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Now that it's the new year, I've decided to turn over a new leaf.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yeah? You finally decided to wipe the slate clean?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: You got it! I have a new job, I'm living in a new city, with new friends! This is my opportunity to make some small changes in the way I live my life.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: So what are you going to do? Take up an art class or something?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, first of all, I've decided to stop smoking. It's not that I'm pinching pennies or anything, it's just that I've been smoking since I was sixteen, and I think it's time to stop.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I'm with you on that one. Anything else you're planning on doing?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: One last thing, I've decided to come out of the closet.

dialogue.speaker: B

title: Upper - Intermediate The Office - Business Plan
description: Learn intermediate the office - business plan through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I've had it! I'm done working for a company that is taking me nowhere!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: So what are you gonna do? Just quit?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: That's exactly what I am going to do! I've decided to create my own company! I'm going to write up a business plan, get some investors and start working for myself!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Have you ever written up a business plan before?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, it can't be that hard! I mean, all you have to do is explain your business, how you are going to do things and that's it, right?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: You couldn't be more wrong! A well written business plan will include an executive summary which highlights the idea of the business in two pages or less. Then you need to describe your company with information such as what type of legal structure it has, history, etc.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well that seems easy enough.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Wait, there's more! Then you need to introduce and describe your goods or services. What they are and how they are different from competitors'? Then comes the hard part, a market analysis. You need to investigate and analyze hundreds of variables! You need to take into consideration socioeconomic factors from GDP per capita to how many children on average the population has! All this information is useful so that you can move on to your strategy and implementation stage, where you will describe in detail how you will actually execute your idea.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Geez. Is that all?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Almost, the most important piece of information for your investors will be the financial analysis. Here you will calculate and estimate sales, cash flow and profits. After all, people will want to know when they will begin to see a return on their investment!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Umm. I think I'll just stick to my old job and save myself all the hassle of trying to start up a business!

vocabulary.definition: Organization of the business
To put into effect; carry out

An apparent probability of advancement, success, profit, etc.
Capable of being done, effected, or accomplished

title: 187 - Going On A Diet
description: Learn going on a diet through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Oh man! I've been starving myself for days now and I haven't lost an ounce!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Are you trying to lose weight?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Yeah, my friend is getting married next month and I'm supposed to be a bridesmaid. I have to fit into my dress and look nice for her wedding, but I haven't lost any weight! Look at these love handles.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: You don't have to starve yourself to lose weight. I think that's where you're going wrong.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Why? If I eat less, then my body will start eating away at my fat reserves right?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Not really. You should try to not eat foods high in calories, salts or saturated fats. Stay away from oily food and artificial flavors.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: So you are saying that I should eat, but I should just watch what I eat?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes! You can also try to reduce your intake of carbohydrates and foods that are high in cholesterol. You can have steamed veggies or increase your protein intake found in chicken or fish.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: If I do all this do you think I can lose twenty pounds in four weeks?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Don't count on it.

vocabulary.definition: To be very hungry
Folds of excess fat on either side of the waist
A unit of heat
A quantity take in
Do not rely on, depend on

A diet high in protein and low in carbohydrates
Diesase in which people starve themselves to be thin
Extremely fat
Not containing many carbohydrates

title: 188 - Asking For A Raise
description: Learn asking for a raise through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Excuse me sir, may I talk to you?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Bill! Sure, come on in. What can I do for you?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well sir, as you know, I have been an employee of this prestigious firm for over ten years.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I won't beat around the bush. Sir, I would like a raise. I currently have three companies after me and so I decided to talk to you first.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: A raise? Son, I would love to give you a raise, but this is just not the right time.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: I understand your position, and I know that the current economic downturn has had a negative impact on sales, but you must also take into consideration my hard work, pro-activeness and loyalty to this company for over a decade.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Taking into account these factors, and considering I don't want to start a brain drain, I'm willing to offer you a ten percent raise and an extra five days of vacation time. How does that sound?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Great! It's a deal! Thank you, sir!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Before you go, just out of curiosity, what companies were after you?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Oh, the electric company, gas company and water company!

title: 191 - Daylight Savings Time
description: Learn daylight savings time through this lesson.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Did you set your clock forward for daylight savings time?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: What? Why do we have to do that?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Well, at the start of the spring we usually have more daylight in the mornings and less in the afternoon. This is basically due to our position on the planet and the rotation of the earth. In any case, to take better advantage of the daylight available, we compensate by moving our clocks forward one hour.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: I see. That's convenient! I never understood things like this, such as GMT. I never know what time zone we are in or when to change my clock!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: That just stands for Greenwich Mean Time. Here in California, we are in Pacific Standard Time, that is eight time zones west of Greenwich. Remember when we were in Beijing? Well, then we were in China Standard Time, and that's eight time zones east of Greenwich!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: That's why it was so weird traveling from Beijing to LA! Because of the huge time difference, even though we left Beijing at noon and flew for more than eight hours, we still arrived in LA the same day at noon! It's like we went back in time!
